abstract.text: Destroys the scene and frees file locks on the underlying file or directory.

All references related to the scene should be released before destruction. If active related references exist, this method will still destroy the scene, but subsequent scene-related methods will fail. The results of accessing methods after destroying are undefined.
Destroying is not necessary if the scene has not been loaded.
A scene is a class that represents the 3D map. You need to inject in all the required data associated with a venue to instantiate and load a Scene.
Destroys the scene and frees file locks on the underlying file or directory.

All references related to the scene should be released before destruction. If active related references exist, this method will still destroy the scene, but subsequent scene-related methods will fail. The results of accessing methods after destroying are undefined.
Destroying is not necessary if the scene has not been loaded.
Mappy provides an elegant and composable interface for mapping, geocoding, and routing.
